personalInfo.splInterest: Working out, running, watching football, spending time with family

tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Played in 14 Web.com Tour events, making four cuts. Finished the Regular Season 174th on the money list...Best outing was a T30 at the Panama Claro Championship in Feburary...Made one cut in six starts on the PGA TOUR to finish 225th in the FedExCup standings...Best finish, a T32, came at Wyndham Championship in August.

2013: Claimed a pair of top-five finishes in 23 PGA TOUR starts...Recorded a then-career-best T4 at the Puerto Rico Open for his second career top-10 on TOUR and his first since a T5 at the 2008 AT&T Classic...Posted a bogey-free, 5-under 65 in the final round of the HP Byron Nelson Championship to finish solo fourth, the third top-10 of his TOUR career.

2012: Capped his year with a come-from-behind win at the Web.com Tour Championship and earned his PGA TOUR card for the 2013 season, doing so for the fourth time via the Web.com Tour. Shot a 6-under 65 in the final round at TPC Craig Ranch in McKinney, Texas, to erase a two-stroke deficit and win by two over James Hahn. Entered the week No. 44 on the money list and needed a win or solo second to join the top-25 money winners on the final list. Shot an opening 65 to join five others in a first-place tie. Rounds of 71-67 left him two shots back of 54-hole leader Justin Hicks. Got out of the gate in the final round quickly, with six birdies in his first 12 holes to take the lead from Hicks, who would stumble with a triple bogey at No. 14 to fall out of contention. Was unshakeable on the final day and hit 16 of 18 greens in regulation. First-place check for $180,000 vaulted him to No. 9 on the season-ending list as he joined 24 others headed to the TOUR in 2013. Finished the season No. 2 in Putting Average...First top-10 of the year came when he finished sixth in the Panama Claro Championship after opening with a bogey-free 65 in the first round...Added a second top-10, a T7, at the Stadion Classic at UGA...Became the first player in Web.com Tour history to record two double eagles in competition. Made his second albatross, at the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open, eight years after his firstâat the Albertsons Boise Open...Was T3 at the Cox Classic after a final-round 64 moved him up the leaderboard. Was in a group that featured a double eagle by Matt Hendrix on Friday, a hole-in-one by Jeff Cuzzort on Saturday and a hole-in-one by Jim Herman on Sunday. Joked after the round that he should go to the casino that night, saying, "I might not win, but the guy next to me will!" 

2011: Began the year with five missed cuts...Made the cut in the next three starts before notching his first top-10, at the Mexico Open. Entered the weekend tied for 31st but rounds of 68-67 on the weekend pushed him to T9...Was solo eighth at the Price Cutter Charity Championship, on the strength of weekend rounds of 67-64...Was T6 at the Children's Hospital Classic in Chattanooga. Finished 17-under for the week and was a 15-under on the four par-5s. 2010: Playing on the PGA TOUR, made 23 starts but only managed four cuts, with his top finish a T23 at the season-ending Children's Miracle Network Classic. He also made one Web.com Tour start, at his former home course at the University of Georgia. He T60 at the Stadion Classic at UGA in Athens. 2009: Earned his 2010 PGA TOUR card, thanks to a No. 11 finish on the Web.com Tour money list, highlighted by a win, a second and a third in 23 starts. Finished T2 at the Melwood Prince George's County Open. Finished T3 at the Fort Smith Classic, missing a playoff by a single stroke. Earned his third career Web.com Tour win when he took a one-shot victory over Chad Collins and Derek Lamely at the Price Cutter Charity Championship. 2008: Made the cut in 16 of 28 PGA TOUR starts, with his lone top-10 a T5 at the AT&T Classic in his home state of Georgia. 2007: Made the cut in 17 of 26 events during the Web.com Tour season, with nine top-25s. Finished the year No. 8 on the money list, with $293,834. Posted two runner-up finishes. First came at his former college campus at the University of Georgia in the Athens Regional Foundation Classic at 15-under 273, just one shot shy of winner Martin Laird, who birdied the final hole for the win. Two weeks later, carried a three-stroke lead into the final round of the Fort Smith Classic, but a bogey on the 72nd hole left him one shot behind winner Jay Williamson. Notched the second victory of his career at the Northeast Pennsylvania Classic, making birdie on two of the final three holes and finishing the event at 14-under 270, one stroke ahead of Richard Johnson and Patrick Sheehan. The win helped him share Player of the Month honors in August with Nick Flanagan. Had a hole-in-one on No. 6 during the second round of the Peek'n Peak Classic. 2006: Made the cut in 14 of 26 starts on the Web.com Tour, with four top-10 finishes. Ended the year No. 34 on the money list, with $163,981. Led the Tour in Putting Average (1.735) and finished eighth in Birdie Average (4.08). 2005: Rookie on the PGA TOUR after finishing ninth on the Web.com Tour money list in 2004. 2004: Made the cut in 15 of 24 starts with three top-25s. During his first year on the Web.com Tour, recorded six top-10s. Notched his first Tour win at the Chattanooga Classic with a total of 21-under 267, one stroke ahead of Chris Anderson and Johnson Wagner. Finished runner-up at the Knoxville Open, when he lost a playoff to Hunter Haas...Had a double eagle at the Albertsons Boise Open.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Walked on the golf team at the University of Georgia three different times.
tourBios.personal: Parents started him in golf. His father also played professional soccer...Parents started him in golf. His father also played professional soccer...Says winning the 2012 Web.com Tour Championship and having his wife and son meet him on the 18th green following the victory is his biggest thrill in golf.

Had a hole-in-one on No. 6 during the second round of the Peek'n Peak Classic. 2006: Made the cut in 14 of 26 starts on the Web.com Tour, with four top-10 finishes. Ended the year No. 34 on the money list, with $163,981. Led the Tour in Putting Average (1.735) and finished eighth in Birdie Average (4.08). 2005: Rookie on the PGA TOUR after finishing ninth on the Web.com Tour money list in 2004. 2004: Made the cut in 15 of 24 starts with three top-25s. During his first year on the Web.com Tour, recorded six top-10s. Notched his first Tour win at the Chattanooga Classic with a total of 21-under 267, one stroke ahead of Chris Anderson and Johnson Wagner. One of three former University of Georgia golfers to win on Tour in 2004, joining Ryuji Imada and Franklin Langham. Finished runner-up at the Knoxville Open, when he lost a playoff to Hunter Haas...Had a double eagle at the Albertsons Boise Open. Won three times on the Hooters Tour, where he was a member from 2000-03, including most recently at the 2003 President Casino Broadwater Classic. Amateur: Walked on the golf team at the University of Georgia three different times.
tourBios.personal: Parents started him in golf. His father also played professional soccer...Says winning the 2012 Web.com Tour Championship and having his wife and son meet him on the 18th green following the victory is his biggest thrill in golf.

dyn.dynResults: He has finished 1st on the Web.com Tour 4 times.
